Karl Wright wrote:
....
>
>
>
> At some point one really has to notice that you are in effect building
> features of a true database out of berkeley db plus lucene; if you used
> something like postgresql with the proper indexes you may be surprised
> at its performance, esp. if you can contrive to query multiple uri's out
> of it at once. I've done this in (separate) crawling work by fetching
> everything that fits a given schedule slice, for instance, where if the
> slice is longer the query simply returns more uri's. The real point is
> that someone else spent lots of time optimizing disk access, so you may
> not have to.
>






















True. Would be interesting to learn what the upper bounds, scale and 
performance-wise, an RDBMS imposes on crawls.

St.Ack
